note_content.Chief Complaint: Chest discomfort and shortness of breath on exertion.
note_content.History of Present Illness: Reports increasing episodes of chest pain and breathlessness, especially when climbing stairs or walking uphill over the past 2 months.
note_content.Past Medical History: Hypertension managed with medication, past smoker, quit 5 years ago.
note_content.Family History: Father had a myocardial infarction at age 62.
note_content.Social History: Works as a financial advisor, lives with wife, does not exercise regularly, denies alcohol, tobacco or drug use.
note_content.The Review of Systems: Occasionally dizzy, no syncope, no palpitations. No complaints of upper or lower extremity swelling, No cough.
note_content.Physical Examination: Mild obesity, lungs clear, cardiac examination shows regular rate and rhythm, no murmurs, soft S4 noted, no gallops or rubs.
note_content.Investigations: EKG showed mild left ventricular hypertrophy, chest x-ray was normal.
note_content.Differential Diagnosis: Angina pectoris, myocardial infarction, aortic stenosis
note_content.Plan: Refer for stress test, continue antihypertensive medication, advise to start low-impact aerobic exercises, consider dietary consultation for weight management, follow-up in 2 weeks or sooner if symptoms worsen.
